Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap.handler

Interface QuotaState

  • public interface QuotaState
    Operations available when responding to quota commands.
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    AuthenticatedHandler.getQuota(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.quota.QuotaManager, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.MailboxStore, java.lang.String, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap.handler.QuotaState), AuthenticatedHandler.getQuotaRoot(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.quota.QuotaManager, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.MailboxStore, java.lang.String, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap.handler.QuotaState), AuthenticatedHandler.setQuota(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.quota.QuotaManager, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.MailboxStore, java.lang.String, java.util.Map<java.lang.String, java.lang.Long>, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap.handler.QuotaState)

    • Method Detail

      • proceed

        void proceed​(AuthenticatedHandler handler)
        Proceeds with the quota operation using the QuotaManager.

        The server will query or update quota using the configured QuotaManager.

        Parameters:
        handler - continues receiving authenticated commands

      • quotaNotSupported

        void quotaNotSupported​(AuthenticatedHandler handler)
        Quota is not supported by this server.
        Parameters:
        handler - continues receiving authenticated commands

      • sendQuota

        void sendQuota​(java.lang.String quotaRoot,
               java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​long[]> resources,
               AuthenticatedHandler handler)
        Sends quota information.

        For GETQUOTA: sends the quota for the specified root. For SETQUOTA: sends the updated quota.

        Each resource entry has: [usage, limit].

        Parameters:
        quotaRoot - the quota root name
        resources - map of resource name to [usage, limit]
        handler - continues receiving authenticated commands

      • sendQuotaRoots

        void sendQuotaRoots​(java.lang.String mailboxName,
                    java.util.List<java.lang.String> quotaRoots,
                    java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​java.util.Map<java.lang.String,​long[]>> quotas,
                    AuthenticatedHandler handler)
        Sends quota root information for GETQUOTAROOT.
        Parameters:
        mailboxName - the mailbox name
        quotaRoots - the quota roots that apply to this mailbox
        quotas - map of quota root to its resources (resource to [usage, limit])
        handler - continues receiving authenticated commands

      • quotaFailed

        void quotaFailed​(java.lang.String message,
                 AuthenticatedHandler handler)
        Quota root not found or no permission.
        Parameters:
        message - the error message
        handler - continues receiving authenticated commands

      • serverShuttingDown

        void serverShuttingDown()
        Server is shutting down, close gracefully.

        Sends an untagged BYE response indicating the server is shutting down and closes the connection.
